msg.description: Any English sentence, meant as information for developers and implementers. Avoid displaying this to the users and especially do not expect those messages to stay stable.

msg_localised.description: Optional localized message that can be displayed to the user if existing. The language can be set by in the request or will fallback to English.

id.description: The request uuid that can be used to identify and trace API calls.

host.description: Server host and protocol from which request was handled.

count.description: the length of the results array.

results.description: The envelope of items, that are usually objects. We are generally sending back arrays even if there was just one requested resource.

created_at.description: The date and time entity was created

updated_at.description: The date and time entity was updated

done_at.description: Date when this cart was used in a transaction (currently). If date is not null, this cart must not be used.

temporary_staff.description: Staff who was lending permissions temporarily (in case that 'cashier_staff' did not have that permission)

custom_id.description: User defined (human readable) identifier for the cart, e.g. counting number 1, 2, 3 ...

client_id.description: Producer side unique identifier to resolve downstream mapping targets, e.g. GUID or UUID

lps.description: Lean Payment System: If TRUE the client application will process this cart with minimal validation and without forced property fetching. Use on at your own risk.

instant_checkout.description: If TRUE this cart will be checked out immediately and thus landing on the payment screen.

immutable.description: If TRUE this cart will not be editable, thus a user can not remove nor add new items.

oneOf.description: The Tillhub pricebook resource asscociated with the customer at that moment

product_supplier_name.description: Custom identifier for the product's supplier

is_service.description: If true, this item represents a service and might come with answers to service questions

discountable.description: Supports correct discount behavior without product lookup

vat_rate.description: VAT rate in the range 0-1. Required when "tax" value is not present. The only one active VAT with the same rate must be defined in the system (does not apply when "tax" value is present)

vat_rate_class.description: Rate class from 'taxes.rate_class' according to international standards, used in Germany to map types for e.g. fiscalization

amount.description: The gross/net input price per quantity of 1.0 and before any discounts

net.description: A monetary value as .2Decimal excluding taxes, $10 = 10.00

gross.description: A monetary value as .2Decimal including taxes, 10â‚¬ = 10.00

oneOf.description: The promotion amount on the per unit qty base of 1.
The total promotion amount.
A list of answers to product service questions

items.description: Answer to a product service question

id.description: A Tillhub product question resource identifier.

question.description: The associated Tillhub product question 'content' field.

type.description: The required layout type of the answer

content_type.description: The required content type of the answer

required.description: If true, the answer is mandatory

answer.description: The answer content of a product service question

oneOf.description: If 'number_input_plus_optional_unit_select', this field contains the inputted numerical value.
If 'checkbox', this field contains the selcetd boolean value.
If 'free_text_input' or 'simple_select', this field contains the inputted text.
If 'number_input_plus_optional_unit_select', this field contains the selected unit.

is_voucher.description: If true, this item represents a voucher and must come with voucher information in 'voucher'

oneOf.description: The effective voucher delta record for this item (thus reversable if needed)

client_id.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication. TO BE DEPRECTAED.

source_id.description: The Tillhub or Fleurop Id of the source voucher.

delta_amount.description: The effective change in the value of the voucher or it's creation amount $1.37 = 1.37.

delta_currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

external.description: Make this voucher to follow external logic

external_system_type.description: Define which voucher API implementation to follow

external_system_id.description: Define here whether this voucher system is an external one and which ID it references at the provider. E.g. a Tillhub Account can talk to another one, but permissions and this reference need to be set.

oneOf.description: Replace own accountId with external_system_id in requests when external=true, i.e. /vouchers/external_system_id/voucher_id. If external=false use accountId as usual, i.e. /vouchers/accountId/voucher_id

external_voucher_system_id.description: If using a parent's voucher system, this is the voucher system id of the delegating parent. external_voucher_system_id is to be sent in requests as a query parameter, whenever external_system_id (instead of the own accountId) is used in the url, e.g. vouchers/{external_system_id}/lookup?code=xyz123&system={external_voucher_system_id}.

oneOf.description: Additional parameter for external voucher systems, e.g. Fleurop Voucher Type specifier or id inside external system
If action_type is 'create' - a reference to the voucher template used
Title of the source voucher.
Client specified container to store created abocards and/or vouchers.

type.description: Mainly legacy support for Fleurop flows.

status.description: Client side recorded booking state of the delta operation.

is_refund.description: If true, the item was created by (partially) refunding a previous sale.

oneOf.description: Information about a returned item.
The associated Tillhub reason resource.
The  Tillhub reason resource's name.

oneOf.example: Accidentally charged the customer for products he did not buy
oneOf.description: The  Tillhub reason resource's description.

oneOf.example: Cashier entered here a custom reason.
oneOf.description: A client side user defined custom description for this return process.
Copy of the behavior object from the reasons table.

attributes_description.description: A short description of the child attributes in variant products

reference_cartitem_client_id.description: In cases of refund or cancellation, or invoicing a delivery note or selling a saved cart: the client_id of the origin item

used_barcode.description: The barcode used to trigger putting this item into the cart (defaults to the first available barcode from the product)

oneOf.description: Any identifier a user wants to store in the transaction system. E.g. an ID in a thirdy party ERP.

tax.description: Tax rate ID. If not present, the "vat_rate" must be present. The active tax with such ID must be defined in the system

account_number.description: Account number. The only one active account with the same number must be defined in the system (does not apply when "account" value is present)

oneOf.description: The list of applied addons

items.description: Any applied addons as they happened at transaction creation time.

addon.description: The Tillhub addon resource reference ID.

oneOf.description: If available - the product set on the addon.

price.description: The fixed price for any addon, completely independent on the quantity.

currency.description: The ISO currency code for the addon's price.

quantity.description: Number of times the addon is applied to the cart item. Respects the max_quantity setting on the Addon

stock_quantity.description: The quantity of this addon, e.g. 1 pc or 0.125kg - this does never affect the price (only used for stock).

name.description: The name of this addon to keep in case if original product has been changed

type_name.description: The value interpretation type of the discount, needed to map from transaction legacy discounts and back, value and rate will be still respected

group.description: The logical group type of the discount, reflecting it's origin.

external_reference_id.description: A caller defined custom ID for the purpose of syncing from external resources, or to use in analytics.

assignment_id.description: Identification of the process that created this discount

assignment_source.description: Identification of the source of the process that created this discount

oneOf.description: If true, this discount was trigger automatically.
Rate class from 'taxes.rate_class' according to international standards, used in Germany to map types for e.g. fiscalization

product_supplier_name.description: Custom identifier for the product's supplier

is_service.description: If true, this item represents a service and might come with answers to service questions

discountable.description: Supports correct discount behavior without product lookup

amount.description: The gross/net input price per quantity of 1.0 and before any discounts

net.description: A monetary value as .2Decimal excluding taxes, $10 = 10.00

gross.description: A monetary value as .2Decimal including taxes, 10â‚¬ = 10.00

vat_rate.description: VAT rate in the range 0-1. Required when "tax" value is not present. The only one active VAT with the same rate must be defined in the system (does not apply when "tax" value is present)

oneOf.description: The list of applied addons

items.description: Any applied addons as they happened at transaction creation time.

addon.description: The Tillhub addon resource reference ID.

oneOf.description: If available - the product set on the addon.

price.description: The fixed price for any addon, completely independent on the quantity.

currency.description: The ISO currency code for the addon's price.

quantity.description: Number of times the addon is applied to the cart item. Respects the max_quantity setting on the Addon

stock_quantity.description: The quantity of this addon, e.g. 1 pc or 0.125kg - this does never affect the price (only used for stock).

name.description: The name of this addon to keep in case if original product has been changed

discounts.description: external discounts that only take either discount format

anyOf.description: discount based on rate, e.g. 10% = 0.1. Client should will apply this based on the volume of that cart item.
discount based on value, e.g. 10 EUR = 10. Client should will subtract this from the volume of that cart item.
discount based on amount total, e.g. 10 EUR = 10. Clients do no calculations and will subtract this value from a cart item.
discount based on amount per item, e.g. 10 EUR with qty 100 will be = 1000. Clientstake this value and multiply it by the qty.

oneOf.description: Any identifier a user wants to store in the transaction system. E.g. an ID in a thirdy party ERP.

tax.description: Tax rate ID. If not present, the "vat_rate" must be present. The active tax with such ID must be defined in the system

account_number.description: Account number. The only one active account with the same number must be defined in the system (does not apply when "account" value is present)

currency.description: The ISO currency code for the addon's price.

quantity.description: Number of times the addon is applied to the cart item. Respects the max_quantity setting on the Addon

stock_quantity.description: The quantity of this addon, e.g. 1 pc or 0.125kg - this does never affect the price (only used for stock).

name.description: The name of this addon to keep in case if original product has been changed

anyOf.description: discount based on rate, e.g. 10% = 0.1. Client should will apply this based on the volume of that cart item.
discount based on value, e.g. 10 EUR = 10. Client should will subtract this from the volume of that cart item.
discount based on amount total, e.g. 10 EUR = 10. Clients do no calculations and will subtract this value from a cart item.
discount based on amount per item, e.g. 10 EUR with qty 100 will be = 1000. Clientstake this value and multiply it by the qty.

oneOf.description: Additional meta data
Additional data for a customer
The Tillhub pricebook resource asscociated with the customer at that moment

opened_at.description: Date when this cart was opened. If date is not null, this cart must not be used.
